2072.subject: MAE
2072.descrlong: Ideal for experienced teachers who are ready to move beyond traditional conceptions of teaching and learning. Participants consider alternative conceptions of education, such as progressive and emancipatory traditions. Emphasis is placed on understanding how engaging in the practices and perspectives advocated by the major architects of alternative conceptualizations impact the living and growing of students, the material conditions that contextualize the work of teachers, and the nature of society. (Offered every other fall semester.)
